DefaultEvent.Description:
You uncover a log-book buried beneath a pile of rags and water-claimed bones. The writing reveals the ship was bound for Scrimshander, containing a precious cargo: a brilliant historian's lost work. The log tells of a passenger obtained; a jilly-stung Chelonate hunter. It describes how he insisted that he be allowed into the cargo hold. Of a pitched battle that ensued when he wasn't. Dried stains underfoot tell the rest. The hold remains secure. 

Breaking it open, you discover a box of bone carvings providing an description of the Chelonate's great turtle and an account of its death. According to this account, the turtle was not hunted - as the Chelonates claim - but was already dead when they found it.

[You could deliver the bone carvings to Scrimshander.]
DefaultEvent.Name: Captain's log

ChildBranches.Name: Go deeper inside the wreck
ChildBranches.Description: The first sweep of your lantern reveals wreckage scattered across the lower deck. Fallen weapons, fallen lives.

DefaultEvent.Description: The hull door opens with a disquieting crunch. A crewman stops to pick bits of skull from his boot. Inside the wreck, bones haunt every surface. Each bone has been split, and hollowed out - so that both inside and out could be inscribed. Some of the bones are dated - the first in each skeleton. It appears the crew were chosen for scrivening one at a time. There is something legible on the right ulnar of an otherwise unmarked skeleton: Scrimshander.
DefaultEvent.Name: You don your diving gear

ChildBranches.Name: Board the wreck
ChildBranches.Description: The ship is silent as its watery grave. You'll have to enter to uncover it's secrets.

Description: The wreck has fallen into a crevice in the zee-bed. It lies embraced by the stones.
Name: Ship of Answers
